pr_title: Minor cleanup of JDBC connector credential handling

timeline.bodyText: ExtraCredentialAuthenticationConfig or ExtracCredentialCredentialConfig? Because we are using extra credentials infra to pass to authentication credentials.
timeline.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText:
Either of those seem redundant to me. This class configures how we use "extra credentials" for the JDBC connector. The phrase "authentication credential" seems redundant given that the purpose of a credential is to be used for authentication.
I'll leave this for now, but we can follow up and rename if you feel strongly about it.
replies.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: Commit message looks invalid. You are not using methods, but modules.
timeline.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText: This is using @Provides methods (which live inside modules) rather than a Provider. I've always called these "provider" methods but I'll update this to be @Provides since that matches the Guice documentation.
replies.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: Actually, I see your point, this change is about both using @Provides methods and switching to explicit modules, so I'll update the message to reflect that. It previously used implicit/inline modules with providers.
replies.author: electrum
